DESCRIPTION OF THE ANHYDROUS AMMONIA STORAGE / DISTRIBUTION PLANT AND THE REGULATED SUBSTANCE HANDLED AT A&K FEED & GRAIN COMPANY, INC., LIME SPRINGS, IOWA.
This facility is a bulk anhydrous ammonia storage and distribution plant. The anhydrous ammonia that is stored at this facility is distributed to agricultural crop producers in the surrounding area who utilize the anhydrous ammonia for crop nutrient purposes.

The system consists of nurse tanks and one storage tank with associated piping, valves, liquid pump and other miscellaneous equipment.

GENERAL ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION PROGRAM & CHEMICAL SPECIFIC PREVENTION STEPS: This facility complies with EPA's accident prevention rule and all applicable state and local codes and regulations. The anhydrous ammonia system is designed, installed and maintained in accordance with ANSI Standard K-61.1 - 1989 and state law.

FIVE YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY: A&K Feed & Grain Company, Inc. has not experienced any accidental release of anhydrous ammonia in the last five years that caused death, injury, property or environmental damage, evacuations or shelterings in place.

EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM: In the event of an emergency involving our Anhydrous Ammonia tank, it is our policy to notify the Lime Springs Fire Department and the Howard County LEPC. We have discussed this policy with them and sent copies of our contingency plan to both the fire department and the Howard County LEPC. The fire department has inspected the facility.

PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY: Continue to update the contingency plan as needed and continue with safety schools and updates with employees.
